intro: Sisymbrium andinum var. exauriculatum, commonly known as the Andean cuckoo's wing, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, yellowish flowers arranged in racemes. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its unique morphology and restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
